comments.body: without the ? one would be required to define "helpers" when using in this [manor](https://github.com/newbish/DefinitelyTyped/blob/a9c6cb9c7c9ed57c332cefa4e19061d8768c4c59/types/jsreport-core/jsreport-core-tests.ts#L3-L7).
The examples in https://github.com/jsreport/jsreport-core#quick-example don't include `helpers`, so it is likely it is indeed optional.

I don't believe it should be required to pass this path to the engine when defining a Template since I don't believe it's a required field and it's normally supplied via the engine.

https://github.com/jsreport/jsreport-core/blob/b3f907cc3b8a4fe18dc91f48430b2df6e691264c/lib/render/render.js#L54
`data` is not required? Could you show the doc about this here?
Never mind about this. it's OK as what it looks like now.

If you don't want remove `?` at line 21,23,25, remove `Partial` here.
```ts
template: Template;
```
changed it back to Partial since that appears to be needed to support downstream plugins
I have been looking at implementing the TemplateRegistery which I think makes a lot of sense but it's going to break a lot downstream.
